quotes.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that societies have ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
Religion, to me, is a bureaucracy between man and God that I don't need.
Everyone starts out being an atheist. No one is born with belief in anything. Infants are atheists until they are indoctrinated.
An atheist loves his fellow man instead of god. An atheist believes that heaven is something for which we should work now--here on earth for all men together to enjoy.
The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.
Even the atheists, who have pretended to disbelieve in God, have believed in Truth.
“There are no gods, no devils, no angels, no heaven or hell. There is only our natural world. Religion is but myth and superstition that hardens hearts and enslaves minds.”
It is not as in the Bible, that God created man in his own image. But, on the contrary, man created God in his own image.
Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning.

An atheist believes that a hospital should be built instead of a church. An atheist believes that a deed must be done instead of a prayer said. An atheist strives for involvement in life and not escape into death. He wants disease conquered, poverty vanquished, war eliminated.
A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading.
An atheist may be simply one whose faith and love are concentrated on the impersonal aspects of God.
To be an atheist requires an indefinitely greater measure of faith than to recieve all the great truths which atheism would deny.
The atheist, by merely being in touch with reality, appears shamefully out of touch with the fantasy life of his neighbors.
The atheist is cheating whenever he makes a moral judgment, acting as though it has an objective reference, when his philosophy in fact precludes it.
Be an atheist if you want, but do not believe in anything unquestioningly.
Being an atheist makes someone a clearer thinking, fairer person. They are not doing things to be rewarded in heaven; they're doing things because they're right, because they live by a moral code.
One of the great tragedies of mankind is that morality has been hijacked by religion.
Question with boldness even the existence of a God; because, if there be one, he must more approve of the homage of reason, than that of blind-folded fear.
An atheist strives for involvement in life and not escape into death.
Atheism is nothing more than the noises reasonable people make when in the presence of religious dogma.
The true atheist is the one who refuses to see God's image in the face of their neighbour.
I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world.
Religion is dangerous because it allows human beings who don't have all the answers to think that they do.
It is time that we admitted that faith is nothing more than the license religious people give one another to keep believing when reasons fail.
We should foster a culture in which people’s private religious beliefs, including atheists and agnostics, are respected.
Atheists are pious people.
An atheist is a man who has no invisible means of support.
The atheist has no hope.
Atheists can be good people; they just have no objective way to judge the conduct of those who are not.
An atheist is a man who believes himself an accident.
All children are born Atheists; they have no idea of God.
A man cannot become an atheist merely by wishing it.
An atheist is someone who thinks (but doesn't believe) that nothing created everything.
The existence of a single atheist does not disprove the existence of God.
Being an atheist is a matter not of moral choice, but of human obligation.
Being an atheist frees you up to live this life properly, happily, and fully.
Atheists express their rage against God although in their view He does not exist.
An atheist is a man who looks through a telescope and tries to explain what he can't see.
The atheist worldview of life is a materialistic culture that frees humanity from superstition.
